content: The US Department of Justice (DOJ) is split over its investigation into Binance, the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, over allegations it violated anti-money laundering laws and sanctions. Some DOJ prosecutors believe the evidence already gathered warrants aggressive action against Binance and its executives, including founder Changpeng Zhao, while others want more time to review the evidence. The investigation has been ongoing since 2018 and has involved the DOJ's Money Laundering and Asset Recovery Section, the US Attorney's Office for the Western District of Washington, and the National Cryptocurrency Enforcement Team.
